channel.title: Stop leaving shadow topics after a move
channel.description:
When a topic is moved, the moderators seem to always leave the shadow topic (such as [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,647263.msg4352953.html#msg4352953]this topic[/url]) in its place. I don't see a reason for leaving this, it just seems counter productive - why bother moving a thread if you're just going to keep a thread in its current place?
Before the "staff shouldn't have to work" bandwagon arrives - it's a single checkbox (it could even be automated with a single script edit)

item.title: Stop leaving shadow topics after a move
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:31, topic:528529”]I don’t understand why everyone is becoming hostile on this thread, it isn’t a debate thread it is a suggestion thread. Calm down.

I agree that shadow threads are annoying to older members because they don’t necessarily need them. However, if we want the forum to remain user friendly we should keep it. It does help the new members find there not only their topics have been moved to but where other topics have been moved to. Replacing this with a pm or comment system would not fix anything as neither are helpful to newer users.

This being said, the older members just have to suck it up and ignore them. New members are as important as the older ones, and if we don’t help them then we won’t have any.[/quote]

A script to send a PM to every member who has commented on that thread within the last week (including the OP) explaining that the thread was moved, and where it was moved to would probably be a lot more helpful (as well as feeling kinder) than just a thread. The user doesn’t get any notification that the thread was moved unless they actually look for the “Moved:” thread.
